text: Will Diffractor support setindex? I read somewhere mutation was a goal iirc

elements.text: Will Diffractor support setindex? I read somewhere mutation was a goal iirc

text: As I understand, no, mutation is still a ways off.

elements.text: As I understand, no, mutation is still a ways off.

text: AD newbie question: what makes mutation difficult for reverse-mode AD? As a side note, it seems as if pytorch supports a limited form of mutation according to their 2019 paper, but it’s not really elaborated on in detail there and I’m not sure what the current state of mutation in pytorch is now.

elements.text: AD newbie question: what makes mutation difficult for reverse-mode AD? As a side note, it seems as if pytorch supports a limited form of mutation according to their 2019 paper, but it’s not really elaborated on in detail there and I’m not sure what the current state of mutation in pytorch is now.

text: I don't really understand it. Something to do with aliasing. And it's not a reverse-mode AD issue. e.g. I believe ReverseDiff has no problems with mutation. It's I think a source-to-source difficulty.

elements.text: I don't really understand it. Something to do with aliasing. And it's not a reverse-mode AD issue. e.g. I believe ReverseDiff has no problems with mutation. It's I think a source-to-source difficulty.
